faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is a local service agent or partner in the UAE?
items.answer: An LSA or partner is a UAE-recognised citizen who empowers you to set up your business in the mainland for professional and industrial activities. An LSA is essential to launch and operate in the UAE, unless your business activity falls under the list of approved activities.

items.question: What are the differences between a local service agent and a local sponsor in Dubai, UAE?
items.answer: The key difference between a local service agent and a local sponsor is that the former provides representation and facilitation services, whereas the latter holds 51% equity in mainland companies.

items.question: Why do I need a local service agent in the UAE?
items.answer: A local service agent/local partner can manage your business's administrative tasks, from registration and account setup to renewals and attestation, empowering you to focus on core business activities.

items.question: Will a local service agent interfere with my business operations?
items.answer: No, a local service agent or partner does not hold ownership of your business, meaning they cannot interfere with business operations.

items.question: Is a local service agent agreement legally binding?
items.answer: Yes, the LSA agreement is a court-attested contract that outlines roles, responsibilities, and fees, ensuring your 100% ownership rights are legally protected.
